intro: Mimetes palustris, commonly known as the marsh mimetes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Mimetes palustris is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
